Any adult may pick up meals for youth 18 years and younger between the hours of 7:30 am and 1:30 pm, Monday through Friday. Pick up at one of these five elementary school sites: (College Park, Foster City Elementary, Laurel, Lead and Sunnybrae).

For more information please visit www.smfcsd.net or contact Child Nutrition Services at 650-312-1968.

Welcome to Tech Tuesdays where we’ll feature happenings in Technology! On Day 19 of #31daysofSMFCSDgratitude, we celebrate our Chromebook/Hotspot Distribution Team for their massive effort to clean and distribute 3,400 Chromebooks and 900 hotspots to our students.

We appreciate you! #appreciatingSMFCSDstaff #31daysofSMFCSDgratitude #smfcsd #SMFCSDgratitude

With questions selected from categories that included spelling, history, music and songs with holiday themes, Santa put 14 students from Audubon Elementary, Brewer Island Elementary and Foster City Elementary through their paces. It was a nail-biter, and in the end, Foster City Rotary President Mark Watson presented each school with a check for $2,500 - a wonderful holiday gift. Many thanks to the Rotary Club for their generosity and to Santa for being the jolly master of ceremonies! And yes, the answer is--cactus!
